name: Westin Monache Resort Mammoth

reviews.text: After coming to Mammoth for the past ten years or so, and staying in varied accommodation (most mediocre and expensive), I have actually found a place where I am comfortable. The Westin takes Mammoth lodging to a whole new level....and thank you for that, Westin.
reviews.title: Mammoth lodging at its best....by far

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very comfortable beds with nice sheets, and I am picky on that point. Very clean. Nice service from all of the staff from housekeeping to restaurant. Decent exercise room, although several of the machines were not working properly when I was there. The room may not be ultra luxurious in every way, but it is very comfortable, and very adequate. On top of it all, it is quiet...not the zoo atmosphere that I have found in much Mammoth lodging.
reviews.title: Excellent Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant also is a step up for Mammoth cuisine. It's a sophisticated room, with lovely views out over the village and surrounding mountains. While the food was not truly gourmet, it was all of decent quality, with some dishes being really quite memorable. Try the cheese plate or the butternut squash soup. Both really nicely presented and flavourful. The S' mores for dessert were also well done. My one complaint with the restaurant, especially at breakfast, was the length of time it took to get a cappucino. I had to wait ages, and it was explained to us that there was only one cappucino machine, and that there could be quite a delay. On top of that, generally, the cappucinos were often mediocre, and small. However, when you need a cappucino, what are you going to do??? I ordered two, and hoped for the best. Wish this could be ironed out.....The servers at the restaurant tried quite hard to please on the whole.
reviews.title: Great stay, location

reviews.text: My other complaint about the hotel would be the elevators. Have to agree with the other comments that they just take forever at some times of day, and the stairs aren't particularly well located to serve as a replacement. Two elevators for a hotel this size does seem quite inadequate.
reviews.title: Great Service, comfy bed, terrible overpriced restaurant, no lounge/lobby to hang out

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is also crawling with dogs. Didn't bother me, but be warned! There are, apparently, pet-free rooms for those who are sensitive.
reviews.title: Nice stay, but... (pet peeve alert)

reviews.text: Our family loves going to Mammoth, and we've stayed at places all across the board from big private homes (spacious but lots of shlepping) to motel rooms (basic) to the standard ski condo ("interesting decor" but more room). This is the first place that I have bothered to write a review for because it is by far our favorite.
reviews.title: Best hotel on the mountain and perfect for families with young kids

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have young kids and have stayed in various rooms throughout the Westin... standard one bedroom, big one bedroom plus additional TV room with extra pull out bed, and the two bedrooms. For us, a two-bedroom is a must. The two-bedroom has a full kitchen with a big family-sized refrigerator, full-size range, etc. The others had a standard hotel room size refrigerator and 2 burner stovetop, which made a difference between eating out almost every meal except breakfast for the smaller rooms and going to Vons and then cooking most meals in the two-bedroom. Not only is that helpful budget-wise, it also reduces our stress to keep everyone acting perfect on our vacation. Kids can watch a video while waiting for dinner, and mom can watch them and drink some wine... (At least the 2-bedrooms we have been in have a great open floor plan with the kitchen centrally located right by the living room and dining room. It makes it really easy to socialize while cooking.)
reviews.title: Worth every penny

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also happened upon the first floor on one trip, and now always ask for it. While I appreciate the views that some of the upper floor units have had, we much prefer the first floor. There are only a handful of units on the first floor, so I don't know how hard it is to get, but we've been lucky so far. (Apparently they have a computer that automatically assigns you a unit, but you can still ask for a specific location and the staff can change it for you.) Because there are so few units there, it is quiet. You miss out on a lot of the standard hotel noise. Plus, because it is on the same level as the lobby, you get much higher ceilings than the other units. Let's be honest, the Westin units are not huge, and the high ceilings go a long way toward feeling spacious. Last time we got a corner unit, and that meant an extra huge bank of windows in the master bedroom. We kept remarking that it felt like we were in an airy cabin rather than a hotel.
reviews.title: Beautiful Fall Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Probably the best part about being on the first floor though is that you don't have to wait for the elevators. We had enough to schlep during the summer that I was really grateful not to have to wait around for the elevators. During ski season, I think the first floor would be invaluable.
reviews.title: Great location, great hotel, great service!
Above & Beyond
reviews.text: Our kids love the Kids' Club and have made some really fun projects there. It is nothing particularly special-- just a conference room with tons of crafts, some games, and a tv, but our kids now make sure that we stay at "the hotel with the club." We don't argue with free babysitting for an hour or so... Another kid-friendly feature is that we can ask housekeeping for all kinds of helpful items like a high chair, a step stool, a fan for white noise, a DVD player, etc. The more they have, the less I have to bring. Beautiful.

The flat was huge: a living room, a kitchen, 2 rooms, 2 bathrooms, 2 terraces with nice views, 3 flats TV. Expensive but space, quality and cleanness everywhere. Pleasant swimming pool and very good garage (a car or a bus is always needed to go somewhere in Mammoth Lakes).
reviews.title: Nice resort

reviews.text: Our family of 2 adults, 2 teens and 1 dog stayed in a 2 bedroom unit at the Westin Monache over Labor Day Weekend. The resort is a condo hotel and the 2 bedroom unit was spacious, very comfortable and furnished in a pleasant contemporary styling. There is a 3 level underground parking garage, which would be great during times when the snow and ice come outside.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Mammoth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Westin Heavenly Beds were awesome and allowed for a great nights sleep. There was a king bed in each bedroom and a comfortable queen sofa bed in the living room. A total of 6 persons easily could sleep in the unit. The 2 bedrooms are at the end of each hallway and therefore are extremely quiet. We did not hear any neighbors during our entire stay. Plenty of closet space and 3 flat screen TVs throughout the unit. The 2 bedroom unit had a fully stocked kitchen from which we cooked breakfast each morning ... be aware that any smaller unit will only have a kitchenette.
reviews.title: Excellent stay - wonderful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bathrooms are contemporary and very nicely maintained. The master bath had a separate glassed-in shower and soaking tub. The second bath had a tub/shower combination. The 2 bedroom units are the only rooms with 2 bathrooms and this comes in handy on busy mornings with a family of 4. Only suggestion is that more towel racks need to be installed in the bathrooms (one each is insufficient). But water pressure is great and the tub was large for relaxing.
reviews.title: Probably the best hotel in area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The condo hotel is situated on a hillside overlooking the new Mammoth Village. The concept is supposed to be like Whistler Village in British Columbia, but it still has a long way to go. About half of the ground floor retail space was vacant due to the poor economy. In winter, the Village Gondola would be a convenient way to access the ski area without having to drive, but there is a long flight of stairs from the hotel down to the street level in order to access the Gondola building. Could be very exhausting as other posters have mentioned previously.
reviews.title: Loved it! Great Hotel in Mammoth!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I thought that i might not like the hotel and its location after reading some of the reviews here, but it was great. You roll up they park your car, take the skis for you to pick up at the gondola, and then wisk you to your room.
reviews.title: I loved it, and so will you!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was quite wonderful, quiet and the elevators were fast and came right away, so I am not sure what the other reviews were talking about. This is a condo hotel so you are renting some one's condo, but they are all furnished alike, and well maintained. The staff treated my wife and I like royalty and frankly I cannot remember a better ski vacation.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.text: Look for specials and you can save, but the price is worth the service. The white bark resturant was wonderful and a welcome change from the local drunk fest bar/resturants which seem to cater to a rowdie party hard sort of crowd.
reviews.title: Friendly service, but not enough elevators...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I recently spent our second wedding anniversary at the Westin Monache Resort in Mammoth. It was an absolute dream weekend in the Sierra Mountains. Not only was the snowboarding world-class on Mammoth Mt, so was the hotel. The hotel is intimate and warm, yet has the amenities of a large scale hotel. The staff was extremely courteous and professional; the Whitebark Lounge was a great place to relax after a long day of boarding; and the rooms were large and super cozy. Also the location of the hotel in the newly built Mammoth Mt Village is directly across the street from restaurants, bars, and gondola access to the base of the mountain. We plan to spend every anniversary in Mammoth at the Westin Monache Resort!
reviews.title: So Far it's Okay

reviews.title: Perfect from check-in to check-out

description: Surrounded by the spectacular Eastern Sierras, The Westin Monache Resort, Mammoth enjoys a prime location with stunning panoramic views of the mountains.
